title: Why hasnâ€™t Riot fixed Silver?
body:
Silver is literally a 50/50 coin flip where you get a team that “gets it” and and a team that doesn’t. There are a plethora of problems which consist of:

Leavers
Greifers
Unranked (More in S II - S I)
Intentional Feeders
Junglers forgetting Smite
End Game Throwers
Smurfing
List goes on and on…

I doubt people get punished for leaving games and boning people over out of their series or just games in general. Another problem is that people just give up and don’t even play, keep pressing “Surrender” (which should be a reportable offense if it’s done too often by the same person) , and just sit in fountain and move around so they avoid disciplinary action. It’s almost an unbearable experience to climb because you can become hardstuck with all of this happening from game to game.

I’ve climbed out of bronze twice in two different seasons and there wasn’t hardly any toxicity at all, more or less it was a much more enjoyable experience than being in Silver. I’m aware all of this happens in the other elo’s too but Riot definitely needs to look into Silver and do something about it.

Also why doesn’t the game automatically put Smite on as a Summoner if you’re locked Jungle? That would eliminate the thought of forgetting it altogether?
